basics.name: Marno Kulmala
basics.label: Senior Professional Engineer
basics.summary:
I'm an expert in Java based technologies (but I'm also fluent with many other programming languages) and in information technology overall: SW architectures, databases, DevOps + SysOps and testing. 
Agile methods have been in my toolbox for years now and I'm trying out new technologies by developing all sorts of apps in my free time. At the moment I'm using my own time to  learn AI, more about python and trying out zig. 
After years developing with Java I moved to C++ to see new horizons. My most recent experience is from maritime industry.
My long term goal is to be one of the creators of future: AI, robotics and maritime development are close to my heart.

Specialties: Systems development, backend technologies (C/C++, Java world, python), DevOps, Cloud platforms and SW architectures

work.name: Arado
work.summary: Worked as a Senior Consultant in project related to Maritime industry

work.name: Mavericks Software Oy
work.summary:
Worked as consultant in Senior/Lead Java developer roles in different industries: Public Sector, fintech, telecom, OEM. Also involved doing technical interviews for possible candidates for joining Mavericks.
Tech stack used:
- Java (JVM8-17, Eclipse Leshan and LwM2M protocol, device control, Kubernetes + prometheus, Spring, Spring Boot, Wicket, JavaFX, troubleshooting in all forms, flyway, lombok, hibernate, ehcache, java profiling and optimizing with JProfiler and JMC/JCMD), jdeps for module hunting
- Integrations (REST, SOAP, main frames)
- Containers (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Cloud (openstack, AWS)
- Databases (DB2, Postgres, triggers, procedures etc)
- Devops (shell scripting, automation, CI, ansible, yaml, Jenkins, artifactory)
- Embedded (Hardware debugging, basics of yocto distros)
- System testing with robot framework
- Prototyping and learning: Quarkus, MongoDB, Kotlin, nodejs and react
- requirements engineering
Industry level skills related to these:
- Educational services
- fintech (PSD2, monetising, PCI)
- authentication
- Embedded devices (weather stations), IoT

Devops consultation involved: Jenkins, ansible, terraform, flocker, openstack, aws, docker, artifactory, *nix, scripting (bash, python), marathon, mesos, developing and maintaining Platform as a Service

work.name: Multiple Companies
work.summary:
Worked as software architect for couple of companies.

First my tasks included asset management related development and software design tasks. Mostly Maximo cases, but others as well.
Other tasks include architectural decisions, helping other team members in development issues, refining software engineering processes used on daily work and designing better ways to implement things. Here I used these technologies: JEE, Web Services (REST, SOAP), Spring, jython, virtualization, windows, linux, db2, WebSphere, redmine, integrations, Talend Open Studio.

Next I moved to electronic case management on Java tech stack.
Where I used following technologies: JEE, Apache ServiceMix, MySql, IntelliJ, Liferay, xml-technologies, python, tesseract

After that I was doing customs applications with following tech stack: Spring, Oracle DB, Oracle SOA, Weblogic, htlm5, responsive.css

I was also involved in project that was creating new emergency system for Finland. Techstack was: javafx and knockdown.js.

work.name: Protacon Group
work.summary:
Worked as a consultant in Business development as well as R&D tasks related to software engineering and planning software architectures. Acted as lead developer and Scrum mastering. I was also involved in mentoring: teaching other developers about new tech.

Methodologies used: scrum, tdd

Technologies used: Javascript frameworks (mainly node.js but also jquery), Java (version 6 and 7: rest, resteasy, ejb3.X), Servers (Managing and installing: Win 2008 server, ubuntu), tech demos(nacl, kotlin, .net, drupal), orm (jpa2, mybatis), Stripes framework, jms, IBM MQ, Spring, Spring Integration

work.name: Houston Inc.

Technologies used: Antlr, Wicket, GearMan, Guice, Mockito, JDave, Jetty, Resin, Web Services (SOAP), IDM, J2EE, Spring, maven, Struts, ibatis, Weblogic, xml, EJB, jsp, HTML + CSS + jQuery, php, XAMPP, postgres

Methodologies used: Scrum, kanban

work.name: Multiple Companies
work.summary:
I worked more than three years as freelancer for couple of companies in Turku and in Pori.
First I worked as MS Office trainer for Metso (part time job won from schools competition).

Then I worked for Sysforte (nowadays belongs to SysOpen Digia) half an year or so. In Sysforte I worked as Visual Basic programmer for different projects. Mainly on applications that were used in industrial PC's: one of them was a in house ERP for customer.

Last one was Affecto where I worked most of my time as freelancer. My job description was ICT designer which basically meant Document management solutions developer. In technical point of view this meant mainly ASP2+ (vbscript and JavaScript) webapplications and Visual Basic components. I also developed many integrations to other systems related to document management, example of these are autocad integration component and wintime integration component.

Tech used: Windows, desktop development, JS, VB, VBA, ASP, T-SQL, PL/SQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, Document management, Barcode scanning, Sticker printers, Document scanning (Kofax, OCR etc)

certificates.name: IBM Tivoli Enterprise Asset Management Sales Professional v3

references.name: Juha Simola
references.reference: Marno is an easy-going person, there are no dull moments when having him as a teammate. Creates a relaxed and open atmosphere. Has strong talent, seniority and vision in Java development. Communicates openly about possible challenges and always finds time to work for the team, thus helping to create or maintain a psychologically safe culture within the team he is working in.

references.name: Artturi Laitakari
references.reference: Marno is highly focused problem solver with very high talent for analysing and making things happen. Marno is a great addition to any team.

references.name: Jussi Metso
references.reference: Marno is a good team player and does his tasks well. I would recommend Marno to any kind of Information Technology job. Documentum products and Java are the specialities for Marno.
